buffalo3d.interfaces

Interface IObject3dParent

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    IObject3dContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Box, HollowCylinder, Object3dContainer, Rectangle, Scene, ScrollContainer, SkyBox, Sphere, Torus

    public interface IObject3dParent
    Defines the responsibilities for a class that will be a parent of a Object3d. This is the API that a Object3d sees when it wants to interact with its parent.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearChildFocus(Object3d child)
      Called when a child of this parent is giving up focus
      void focusableObjectAvailable(Object3d obj)
      Tells the parent that a new focusable view has become available.
      Object3d focusSearch(Object3d obj, int direction)
      Find the nearest view in the specified direction that wants to take focus
      IObject3dParent getParent()
      Returns the parent if it exists, or null.
      void requestChildFocus(Object3d child, Object3d focused)
      Called when a child of this parent wants focus

    • Method Detail

      • getParent

        IObject3dParent getParent()
        Returns the parent if it exists, or null.
        Returns:
        a IObject3dParent or null if this IObject3dParent does not have a parent

      • requestChildFocus

        void requestChildFocus(Object3d child,
                       Object3d focused)
        Called when a child of this parent wants focus
        Parameters:
        child - The child of this IObject3dParent that wants focus. This view will contain the focused view. It is not necessarily the view that actually has focus.
        focused - The view that is a descendant of child that actually has focus

      • clearChildFocus

        void clearChildFocus(Object3d child)
        Called when a child of this parent is giving up focus
        Parameters:
        child - The view that is giving up focus

      • focusSearch

        Object3d focusSearch(Object3d obj,
                     int direction)
        Find the nearest view in the specified direction that wants to take focus
        Parameters:
        obj - The view that currently has focus
        direction - One of FOCUS_UP, FOCUS_DOWN, FOCUS_LEFT, and FOCUS_RIGHT

      • focusableObjectAvailable

        void focusableObjectAvailable(Object3d obj)
        Tells the parent that a new focusable view has become available. This is to handle transitions from the case where there are no focusable views to the case where the first focusable view appears.
        Parameters:
        obj - The view that has become newly focusable
